intro: Colysis axillaris, commonly known as the axillary colysis, is a rare and unique plant species characterized by its distinctive botanical features. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, known for its soft, hairy stems and showy, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
